Let me get right to the point.
  This special on the JFK assassination is more shallow than a puddle on hot pavement in the month of August.
  The "evidence" used in this nonsensical special has more holes in it than a chunk of Swiss Cheese.
  This show was poorly researched, and when you watch it, you realize how little ABC knows about the JFK murder.
 This is an utter waste of time.
 If you want a REAL, thorough investigation into the murder of JFK, I recommend the show "The Men Who Killed Kennedy".
  Its available on Amazon on DVD and video, and it is well done.
  This ABC show is junk.

Viewing this documentary should be mandatory for anyone person who has seen Oliver Stone's "JFK."  "Beyond Conspiracy" was well produced and researched, it is highly entertaining.  "Beyond Conspiracy" presents a case for the lone gun-man theory, that Oswald alone murdered Kennedy.  Watch Stone's "JFK" then watch "Beyond Conspiracy" and decide for yourself.

They finally got it right!  This documentary sets the record straight in the murder of President John F. Kennedy.  For years, the conspiracy theorists have bombarded the public with misinformation and falsehoods about this terrible event.  As Dr. Josef Goebbels put it, "Tell the lie often enough and it becomes the accepted truth".  No more!  I will comment on three items addressed in the special: the timing of the shooting, the single bullet theory, and Oswald's proficiency with a rifle.
  The conspiracy theorists say that NO ONE could get three shots of in 5 and a fraction seconds.  This sounds reasonable but the 5 second time frame is fallacious.  Visual inspection of the Zapruder Film shows Governor Connally reacting the the first shot at frame 160 by a sharp turn to his right.  The fatal shot was at frame 313.  At 18 frames per second on Zapruder's camera, this works out to 8.5 seconds.
  The next item to consider is the so called "magic bullet".  Popular myth is that Connally was directly in front of, and level with the President in the car and the bullet would have to defy all ballistics to injure both men.  In fact, Connally was 3 inches lower and 6 inches inboard of the President.  In addition to this, his body was turned sharply to the right.  If you look at their positions at the exact moment the bullet struck (Zapruder frames 223/224), their wounds line up and trace back directly to the sniper's nest.
  Lastly, let's examine the shooter; Lee Harvey Oswald.  Holy Writ among conspiracy theorists is that he was a mediocre shot at best.  In fact, examination of Oswald's Marine Corps shooting record shows that he qualified as a Sharp Shooter at a range of 200 yards.  The distance from the sniper's nest to the point where the fatal shot hit was 88 yards.  This was well within Oswald's capability.
  Conspiracy theorists should give due consideration to these points.  Combined this with the "Unsolved History" episode on the same subject which recreates the shooting, Oswald's trip from the 6th floor to the lunch room, and Oswald's encounter with Officer J. D. Tippit.  Do this; be intellectually honest, and you will see that you have subscribed to a False Faith.

The first reviewer for this to come DVD encouraged me to take out my VHS version of this special and to finally sit down and watch it from beginning to end.  And I agree; the archival footage alone is worth the price of admission.  But...
Although I don't think Mr. David R. Von Pein bases his lone nut believing strictly on this special, I would like to remind him and everyone interested in this case to read and listen and to watch everything with a grain of salt.  Even Mr. Dale K. Myers, who supplies the 3-D graphics supporting Oswald's alleged shooting, has to admit that a computer is only as smart as the information you put in it.  If you put in the right coordinates, you could claim Oswald was actually in the Dallas County Records building at the time of the shooting, and still pulled off the same feat (although I think conspiracists would argue that would actually be an easier shot).  Further evidence that you should take this (and everything else connected up with the Kennedy assassination) with a grain of salt is Gerald Posner.
Yes; good old standby Gerald Posner takes part in this special, which surprisingly doesn't really rely that much on facts (it seems more like opinions than anything...are we supposed to take them at their word?) until its last 20 minutes or so.  ...I don't like Posner.  It's nothing personal, it's just that with his book CASE CLOSED, he carries on like he's writing nothing but the truth, but a (fair minded) person educated with just the Warren Commission Report alone will know different.  And yes, because Posner is quote 'telling the truth', he needs to tell the truth.  It's because of Posner's assistance here that I give this special only four stars, and of course listen to its facts (including those of Mr. Myers) even more so with a scrupulous eye.  I'm not totally convinced of a conspiracy in the death of JFK (which is why I can enjoy this type of special), but I'm definitely not convinced of the lone nut theory.

To say this documentary is the final word is at best misleading. I could care less about the documentary's magic bullet information. It's foundation is the Warren Commission report. Without it, the animated reconstruction of the murder is fantasy. Whether there was or wasn't a single bullet that made multiple wounds from the rear is not a case closer. Junk in / junk out ... There are several people with knowledge of the wounds at the hospital and autopsy that state there was one or more entry wounds from the front. Why wasn't this challenged in the documentary? Were the autopsy photos altered? Was Oswald set up as a patsy as some people who were not interviewed by the Warren Commission stated? Were there others who wanted Kennedy dead and had the means to kill him and the power to cover it up? These have always been the nagging questions. I am not sure what happened that day in TX, but anyone who is serious about the topic should see The Men Who Killed Kennedy series and do some additional reading. A recent book with an interesting perspective is JFK and the Unspeakable: Why He Died and Why It Matters. Some facts were covered up--- perhaps it was because leaders were trying to avoid an angry reaction and war (as stated in documentary)--- but perhaps there were sinister elements at play, too. Technology has changed a great deal since 1963 and perhaps much can be explained away today. But trust of political and the monied class has eroded, too. I do not look at governments and news like I did many years ago. Disinformation and lies are used to keep the truth from the public when it is deemed necessary. If I was granted full knowledge of what happened in any one event in history, I would wish for complete knowledge of the Kennedy assassination. Short of that, we will never know. Peter Jennings was a fine news correspondent and television news anchor. This was not one of his best efforts. I found the glossy treatment of the topic and his marching out of people who agreed with the documentary's thesis no more impressive than others done from the conspiracy perspective.

Don't you just love the divide in the reviews. It's all or nothing. Frankly I too was a conspiracy buff for years but the more I learned the more I came to believe that the Warren Commision, and this FINE documentary, had it essentially right. (The order of the shots not withstanding) Here's just a few of the things that will jump out at you once you stop drinking the conspiracy Kool Aid;

- When you put Kennedy and Connelly in their proper positions in the car there is no question about the single bullet "theory". Given the position of the wound on Connelly's back and it's forward and downward path you realize that the bullet HAD to go through Kennedy, there simply is no other way for it to get to that spot on Connelly's back. In additon it is an oblong wound which means the bullet was tumbling and bullets don't tumble until they hit something. So it's either a single bullet or Kennedy shot Connelly with a magic gun that makes a rifle bullet tumble! (Oops, I may have just started a new conspiracy theory!) Let me repeat that and feel free to check me on it... The wound on Connelly's back was an OBLONG wound. The bullet was tumbling. How can you explain that without coming to the conclusion that the bullet hit Kennedy first? Hmmm?

- When Oswald was arrested he was carrying the revolver that several witnesses saw him shoot Officer J. D. Tippit with. It was matched ballistically to the bullets Tippit was shot with. Officer Tippit stopped Oswald for questioning because he matched the discription of the Dealy Plaza shooter which was given to the police by Howard Brennan as he sat on a wall facing the Book Depostitory. Brennan saw Oswald shoot Kennedy and discribed it in vivid detail. He saw Oswald well enough to give the police a discription that enabled Officer Tippit to stop a man who fit that discription. And, by golly, that man turned out to be the one employee who had left the Book Depository, Oswald. Upon being stopped Oswald gunned Tippit down! This is the same Oswald who left his wedding ring and all his money next to his sleeping wife and who told his car pooling pal that he was bringing "curtain rods" to work. No curtain rods were found in the Book Depository but a rifle that Oswald had been photographed with was found with his prints on it and three spent cartridges. (The authenticity of the photo has been verified 29 times and the vast majority of the witnesses, 88%, said they heard three shots. 7% said they heard fewer and only 5% said they heard more.) After the shooting, when a cop stops him, Oswald guns him down! Gee, what does it all mean? Honestly, of all the OBVIOUS things that get lost in the conspiracy haze none is as blatant as Oswald's actions following the shooting. They are clearly the acts of a guilty man. And the fact that a witness gave the police an accurate enough discription of the shooter that Tippit was able to spot Oswald based on it is even omitted in this documentary. Sometimes the most obvious things just get passed over. Ask a conspiracy buff who Howard Brennan was and wait for the blank stare. Once you tell them they'll just have to add him to their never ending list of co-conspiritors.

- The autopsy evidence CLEARLY shows that the wounds to Kennedy's head were a small entry wound in the rear and a large exit wound to the front/right of his head. (Which would account for the recoil back and to the left as this documentary points out.) And please spare me the Best Evidence/Lifton non-sense. This is a guy who came to the conclusion that NONE of the shots came from behind. Try making sense of the bullet that hit Connelly with that guy's theories! (It was actually after reading the Lifton book and that conclusion that I seriously began to question the conspiracy theories. If someone could write a best seller and make THAT obvious of a mistake something had to be rotten.)

John Adams was right--facts are inconvenient things, no more so than when they show once and for all that President Kennedy was murdered by a homicidal punk shooting from a window in the Texas School Book Depository--not, as revisionist liar Oliver Stone would have it, by several gunmen in several places.  At long last, a computer representation of the events that transpired in Dealey Plaza, based on a frame-by-frame analysis of the famous Zapruder film, plausibly suggests what happened and when on that terrible day.  There will always be perfectly honest students of the Kennedy assassination who believe the President's murder was the result of a conspiracy, but this absorbing documentary may give them something to think about.

In any case, many of the conspiracy theories have fatal flaws, or at least unanswerable objections.  For example:  If there was a gunman on the grassy knoll, how could he have escaped detection and capture?  And if there was a gunman who popped up from a convenient sewer and shot at President Kennedy, how did the bullet keep from striking the grille or the windshield of the presidential limousine?  Common sense alone refutes the absured inventions of revisionist loonies like Oliver Stone, and their very source--Mr. Stone's fevered imagination and his talent for disseminating gigantic lies--should dispel whatever credibility these explanations may have had in the first place.

Finally:  If there truly was a conspiracy, why didn't Robert Kennedy try to root it out?  As Attorney General he commanded the formidable investigative resources of the F.B.I., and he would surely have done everything in his considerable power to bring his brother's murderer to justice.  That this fiercely willful and partisan man never investigated the supposed conspiracy behind his brother's death suggests that either there was no conspiracy in the first place or--incredibly--that RFK himself was a part of it.

If you lived through those terrible days in 1963--or even if you didn't--I think you will find satisfaction and a kind of sad comfort in watching this elegant argument for what was almost certainly the simple but tragic truth behind the murder of John F. Kennedy.  Requiescat in pace!

The narrator, Peter Jennings, does something quite revealing at the beginning of the program.  He points out that there are so many conspiracies regarding the Kennedy assassination that "we don't have time to delve into all of them." ... And so what does the program do?  It delves into *none* of them.

In other words, here's a purported documentary that seeks to debunk the idea that JFK was killed as part of a conspiracy and then convenienlty sets aside  consideration of *any* of the conspiracy theories being offered.

Moreover, along with this set-aside of conspiracy theories there is a set-aside of the truckloads of FACTS that back up these various conspiracy theories!

-- No mention is made of the fact that the majority of people present at the assassination site, including the police, pointed to and rushed the grassy knoll.

-- No mention is made of the witnesses who swore that they saw Lee Harvey Oswald and Jack Ruby together before the assassination.

-- No mention is made of the fact that assassination attempts, via a conspiracy,  were foiled in Chicago and Miami before Kennedy went to Dallas.

-- No mention is made of the unlikely number of "accidental deaths" of key witnesses in the case.

-- No mention is made of Kennedy's promise after the Bay of Pigs fiasco to "shatter the CIA into a thousand pieces."

I watched and taped this program when it was first broadcast in 2004 and was so impressed by it, I've kept the tape.  I am glad it is still available on DVD because "Beyond Conspiracy" is a well-done and convincing documentary on the Kennedy assassination that defends the Warren Commission's findings that Lee Harvey Oswald was the only shooter and acted alone.  Ironically, the simplest answer is hard to believe sometimes and many who support one conspiracy theory or another will probably not be swayed by this DVD, but the evidence shown in this report is strong and would need to be dealt with to defend any theories involving magic bullets, second gunman, Oswald's connections with the CIA or KGB, Jack Ruby's ties with the Mafia, etc.

The most eye-opening part of this program are the findings of computer animator Dale Myers.  He designed a computerized 3D replica of Dealey Plaza which utilized the movements of JFK and Governor Connally in the Zapruder film to recreate the shooting.  The computer imagery shows the precise positions in the limousine and how a single bullet passed straight through both men causing their simultaneous reactions.  The bullet is then traced to its exact source--the sixth floor window of the Texas school book depository.  I was very impressed by this footage and think anyone interested in the assassination should see it.

The program also gives a biography of Lee Harvey Oswald with interview clips of his older brother, Robert, a journalist who knew Oswald when he defected to the Soviet Union, and a woman who knew Oswald and his wife in Dallas.  It covers Oswald's troubled childhood, his attraction to Marxist philosophy, in large part, (according to his brother) to stand out from the crowd.  He had a flair for the dramatics (slitting his wrist in Russia so the Soviet authorities would allow him to stay in the country) and an obsessive need to be something more than he was.  When the motorcade route for JFK's visit was published in the paper and was revealed to pass right by the book depository where Oswald was a clerk, he seized the opportunity.  Even more important as evidence of Oswald's sole guilt is information on his plot to assassinate retired general and anti-Communist Edwin Walker.  Also, there is compelling evidence in this program revealing that Oswald was a superb marksman who was more than capable of shooting off the shots in the time allotted.

The program does not ignore the conspiracy theories.  It covers the Warren Commission's failure to address the issue of Cuba and Castro's possible involvement (this area is probably not covered enough to refute conspiracy theorists).  The Mafia ties are examined as well and Jack Ruby is painted as a braggart and loose cannon who would make a poor candidate for a co-conspirator.  The fourth shot on the grassy knoll that scientists, in a 1976 re-examination of the Warren Report, claim can be heard from an open-microphone recording on a police motorcycle is refuted by Myers' computerized time-line of the motorcade that reveals officer McLain (who had always said he was not in position to pick up such a shot) was not in position the scientists claimed (Vince Bugliosi further dispels the fourth shot theory in his book "Reclaiming History").

Finally, the program pokes many holes in Oliver Stone's motion picture "JFK."  It is very unfortunate that many people get their history from Hollywood. THIS DVD is one that needs to be watched on the Kennedy assassination, not a movie with actors and a script that takes artistic license.  One area that is not covered is the simulated trial of Lee Harvey Oswald in London, but, again, Bugliosi (the prosecutor in that trial) will cover this topic in his book.  Again, this program won't turn around everyone's opinion, but any discussion on the subject that does not at least address the compelling evidence revealed in "Beyond Conspiracy" is insufficient.
